docs.snippet: About 30 Times journalists joined Jodi Rudoren, deputy international editor, on her final day of the 22 Push-Up Challenge, to raise awareness of veteran suicide.

docs.snippet: Sarah Palin maintains a community of millions of Facebook fans, and while some cheered her endorsement of Donald J. Trump this week, others called her a sellout of conservatism who was only seeking another moment in the political spotlight.

headline.main: Sarah Palin’s Facebook Fans Say Backing Donald Trump Is Disingenuous

docs.snippet: The C.D.C. said recent blood donations suggest that a substantial portion of the island’s population will become infected by the virus.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Are Surprised by Zika Rate in Puerto Rico
headline.main: Number of Zika-Positive Puerto Ricans Surprises Health Officials

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reveals testing of roughly 9 weeks of blood donations in Puerto Rico shows active Zika infection rate to be as high as 1.1 percent; figure is unexpectedly high and indicates island faces substantial rate of infection by end of year.

docs.snippet: Trump says America was strongest when “politics ended at water's edge.” He's wrong.
The chief operating officer of Facebook has signed the Giving Pledge, a campaign in which the world’s richest people vow to give away at least half their wealth.

headline.print_headline: Sandberg Plans to Use $100 Million for Charity
headline.main: Sheryl Sandberg Said to Plan $100 Million in Charitable Giving

docs.abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission filings indicate Facebook chief operating officer Sheryl Sandberg plans to transfer nearly $100 million of her Facebook shares to fund for charitable causes; donations are expected to benefit women's empowerment and anti-poverty efforts.

docs.snippet: Across the globe, a slim chance of winning in a lottery can get people to vote, pay taxes, drive slower or make sex safe.
